Key Match Events: Mac Allister scored in the 48th minute
De Paul received a yellow card in the 30th minute
Lo Celso received a yellow card in the 71st minute
Nunez received a yellow card in the 39th minute
Davila received a yellow card in the 40th minute
Diaz received a yellow card in the 65th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina will have to cope without eight-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi for their CONMEBOL 2026 World Cup qualifier against Chile
Lionel Scaloni's 28-man squad does not include Messi as he continues to recover from an ankle injury
Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister was in pain after pulling up with an unspecified issue in training and is unlikely to feature against Chile
Defenders Nicolas Tagliafico and Leonardo Balerdi are ruled out through injury
Angel Di Maria and Franco Armani have retired from international football
Valentin Barco is the only natural left-back option in Scaloni's squad
Nahuel Molina and Gonzalo Montiel will compete for a start at right-back
Cristian Romero and Lisandro Martinez are set to be the preferred centre-back partnership
Enzo Fernandez could start in midfield alongside Rodrigo De Paul and Giovani Lo Celso
Scaloni may select another midfielder such as Leandro Paredes or Guido Rodriguez, or start an attacker to link up with Julian Alvarez and Lautaro Martinez
Nicolas Gonzalez, Alejandro Garnacho, and Paulo Dybala are pushing to start
Uncapped players Valentin Castellanos, Giuliano Simeone, Matias Soule, and Ezequiel Fernandez hope to feature
